backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining the cricket scoring backend with types for teams, players, matches, innings, deliveries, and tournament rules, plus CRUD operations and validation logic stored in in-memory maps.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting that graceful error boundary handling (with user-friendly messages and retry buttons) was added to LiveScoring, MatchSetup, Rules, Scorecard, and Teams pages.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Auto-generated summaries of all frontend source files describing component prop corrections, query error handling, routing, store utilities, and modal implementations across the cricket scoring app.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining CSS custom properties for the design system's color tokens in both light and dark modes using OKLCH values.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell for the Cricket Scoring App that mounts the React app into a root div and loads the main TSX entry point as an ES module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React app component that sets up TanStack Router with all application routes (history, teams, setup, live scoring, scorecard, rules) wrapped in QueryClientProvider and a shared Layout shell.
frontend/src/components/BatsmanStatsPane: React component displaying batting statistics (runs, balls, fours, sixes, strike rate) for the striker and non-striker, with visual highlighting for the striker.
frontend/src/components/BottomTabNavigat: Fixed bottom navigation bar with four tabs (History, Teams, Setup, Rules) using TanStack Router Links with active state detection and accent indicator.
frontend/src/components/BowlerStatsPanel: React component displaying the current bowler's statistics (overs, runs, wickets, maidens, economy) looked up by player ID from a players array.
frontend/src/components/BulkPlayerUpload: A multi-step modal dialog for bulk-uploading players to a team via pasted text or file input, with validation (duplicates, length, spacing) and a preview/result flow.
frontend/src/components/ConfigureTournam: A modal dialog for viewing and editing tournament rules (overs, teams, penalties, etc.), converting between backend bigint types and form number values before saving.
frontend/src/components/EndOfInningsModa: A modal that appears at the end of an innings (or for opener selection) to let the user pick the striker, non-striker, and opening bowler for the next innings.
frontend/src/components/EndOfOverModal.t: A modal shown at the end of each over that prompts the user to select the next bowler, excluding the bowler who just bowled.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: The main app shell component providing a sticky header with logo, a centered content area via Outlet or children, bottom tab navigation, and a footer.
frontend/src/components/OverTimeline.tsx: Displays a visual ball-by-ball timeline for the last three overs, grouping deliveries into overs with color-coded circles indicating runs, wickets, and extras.
frontend/src/components/PlayingElevenSel: A component that renders a scrollable checklist of players for selecting a playing eleven, enforcing a configurable maximum selection limit with visual feedback.
Displays a user-friendly error alert for query failures, with special handling for Internet Computer canister errors and an optional retry button.
frontend/src/components/ResetAllDataModa: A confirmation dialog that warns the user about permanently deleting all app data (teams, matches, rules) and provides Cancel/Delete actions with a loading state.
frontend/src/components/ScoreDisplay.tsx: Renders the current match scorecard card showing runs, wickets, overs, innings indicator, and target/required runs for the second innings.
frontend/src/components/WicketModal.tsx: A dialog for recording a wicket dismissal, allowing the user to select the wicket type and the next incoming batsman before confirming.
frontend/src/data/cricketRules.ts: Defines static cricket rule content organized into categories (Scoring, Extras, Dismissals) along with TypeScript interfaces for rule data structures.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: A React hook that creates and caches an Internet Computer backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using TanStack Query, invalidating dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and hook for Internet Identity authentication on the ICP platform, managing login/logout state, identity persistence, and AuthClient creation with configurable options.
frontend/src/hooks/useMatchState.ts: A React hook that manages cricket match state (striker, non-striker, bowler, innings, match result) with localStorage persistence and helper actions like swapping batsmen and ending the match.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines TanStack Query hooks for all backend interactions including teams, players, matches, innings, and deliveries, wrapping actor calls with useQuery and useMutation.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that sets up Tailwind CSS, imports Google Fonts (Inter and Rajdhani), defines CSS custom properties for light/dark themes with navy and orange palettes, and adds cricket-specific utility classes.
frontend/src/lib/matchStore.ts: Utility module for persisting and retrieving cricket match data (stored matches, match metadata, and local match state) in localStorage, handling BigInt serialization/deserialization.
frontend/src/lib/matchUtils.ts: Utility functions for cricket match calculations including formatting overs, computing run rates, and deriving batsman/bowler statistics from ball-by-ball delivery records.
frontend/src/main.tsx: React app entry point that mounts the root component wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/LiveScoring.tsx: Live scoring page that records ball-by-ball deliveries, manages batsman/bowler state, and handles modals for wickets, end of over, and end of innings.
frontend/src/pages/MatchHistory.tsx: Displays a list of stored matches with status badges, and provides options to refresh, reset all data, or start a new match.
frontend/src/pages/MatchSetup.tsx: Multi-step match setup wizard that lets users select teams, choose playing elevens, configure match rules, and then creates the match on the backend.
frontend/src/pages/Rules.tsx: Rules page with tabs for standard cricket rules and configurable tournament rules, displayed in an accordion layout with a modal for editing tournament settings.
frontend/src/pages/Scorecard.tsx: React page that displays a cricket match scorecard, computing and rendering batting and bowling statistics per innings from delivery data fetched via custom query hooks.
frontend/src/pages/Teams.tsx: React page for managing cricket teams, supporting listing, adding teams, adding individual players, and bulk player uploads, with loading/error states handled via query hooks.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration extending the default theme with custom fonts, CSS-variable-based color tokens (including navy and orange palettes), border radii, box shadows, and keyframe animations.
project_state.json: Project state metadata describing a known IC0508 canister-stopped error on the getAllTeams endpoint, an existing graceful error boundary fix, and a pending request to ensure the backend Motoko actor compiles and deploys correctly.
